schema.name: mAdminState
schema.summary: Set the administrative state of this configuration.
schema.label: Enable administrative state
schema.hoverhelp: <p>Set the administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set the check box.</li><li>To make inactive, clear the check box.</li></ul>
schema.description: <p>The administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set to enabled.</li><li>To make inactive, set to disabled.</li></ul>
A descriptive summary for the configuration.
schema.summary: Enter a descriptive summary for the configuration.
schema.name: UserSummary

value.summary: Use the user accounts on the DataPower Gateway.
value.name: local

value.summary: Use an XML file on the DataPower Gateway.
value.name: xmlfile

value.summary: Contact an LDAP server.
value.name: ldap

value.summary: Contact a RADIUS server.
value.name: radius

value.summary: Use Windows Integrated Authentication.
value.name: spnego

value.summary: Contact a z/OS NSS server.
value.name: zosnss

value.summary: Use a custom stylesheet.
value.name: custom

value.summary: Use a TLS certificate from a connection peer.
value.name: client-ssl

schema.name: AUMethod
schema.summary: Set the method to authenticate users.
schema.description: The method to authenticate users.

schema.name: AUZOSNSSConfig
schema.summary: Set the local NSS client that defines how to connect to the NSS server for SAF communication.
schema.description: The local NSS client that defines how to connect to the NSS server for SAF communication.

schema.name: AUKerberosKeytab
schema.summary: Set the Kerberos keytab with the server principal to decrypt client tickets.
schema.description: The Kerberos keytab with the server principal to decrypt client tickets.

schema.name: AUCustomURL
schema.summary: Enter the URL of custom stylesheet.
schema.description: The URL of custom stylesheet.

schema.name: AUInfoURL
schema.summary: Enter the URL of the XML file for authentication.
schema.description: The URL of the XML file for authentication. The XML file can be on the DataPower Gateway or on a remote server. You can use the same XML file to map credentials.

schema.name: AUSSLValcred
schema.summary: Set the validation credentials to authenticate user certificates from TLS peers.
schema.description: The validation credentials to authenticate user certificates from TLS peers during the TLS handshake.

schema.name: AUHost
schema.summary: Enter the host name or IP address of the server.
schema.description: The host name or IP address of the server.

schema.name: AUPort
schema.summary: Enter the listening port on the server.
schema.description: The listening port on the server.

schema.name: AULDAPSearchForDN
schema.summary: Indicate whether to retrieve the user DN with an LDAP search.
schema.description: <p>Whether to retrieve the user DN with an LDAP search.</p><ul><li>When enabled, the login name presented by the user is used with the LDAP search parameters for an LDAP search to retrieve the user DN.</li><li>When disabled, the login name presented by the user is used with the LDAP prefix and suffix to construct the user DN.</li></ul>

schema.name: AULDAPBindDN
schema.summary: Enter the DN to bind to the LDAP server for the LDAP search.
schema.description: The DN to bind to the LDAP server for the LDAP search.

schema.name: AULDAPBindPassword
schema.summary: Enter the password for the DN to bind to the LDAP server for the LDAP search.
schema.description: The password for the DN to bind to the LDAP server for the LDAP search.

schema.name: AULDAPBindPasswordAlias
schema.summary: Enter the password alias for the password used by the DN to bind to the LDAP server for the LDAP search.
schema.description: The password alias for the password used by the DN to bind to the LDAP server for the LDAP search.

schema.name: AULDAPSearchParameters
schema.summary: Set the LDAP search parameters for the LDAP search.
schema.description: The LDAP search parameters for the LDAP search.

schema.name: AULDAPPrefix
schema.summary: Enter the string to add before the user name to form the DN.
schema.description: <p>The string to add before the user name to form the DN. If this value is <tt>CN=</tt> and the user name is <tt>Bob</tt> , the complete DN is <tt>CN=Bob,O=example.com</tt> when the LDAP suffix is <tt>O=example.com</tt> .</p>

schema.name: AUForceDNLDAPOrder
schema.summary: Indicate whether to convert the extracted DN to LDAP format.
schema.description: <p>Whether to convert the extracted DN to LDAP format. This property is essential when the extracted DN from a TLS certificate is in X.500 format. This format arranges the RDNs of the DNs from left to right with forward slashes as separators; for example, <tt>C=US/O=My Organization/CN=Fred</tt> .</p><p>When you retrieve the group name with an LDAP search, the authenticated DN must be in LDAP format. This format arranges the RDNs of the DNs from right to left with commas as separators; for example, <tt>CN=Fred, O=My Organization, C=US</tt> .</p>

schema.name: LDAPsuffix
schema.summary: Enter the string to add after the user name to form the DN.
schema.description: <p>The string to add after the user name to form the DN. If this value is <tt>O=example.com</tt> and the user name is <tt>Bob</tt> , the complete DN is <tt>CN=Bob,O=example.com</tt> when the LDAP prefix is <tt>CN=</tt> .</p>

schema.name: LDAPSSLProxyProfile
schema.summary: The TLS proxy profile is deprecated. Use a TLS client profile.
schema.description: The TLS proxy profile to secure the connection with the LDAP server.

schema.name: AULDAPLoadBalanceGroup
schema.summary: Set the load balancer group of LDAP servers.
schema.description: The load balancer group of LDAP servers. This setting overrides the settings for the server host and port.

schema.name: AUCacheAllow
schema.summary: Set how to cache authentication results.

value.summary: Use the explicit TTL
value.name: absolute
value.description: Caches the results for the period of time that is specified by the cache lifetime. The lifetime is the explicit time-to-live (TTL).

value.summary: Disable
value.name: disabled
value.description: Disables caching. The system does not cache results.

value.summary: Use the configured TTL as the maximum possible TTL
value.name: maximum
value.description: Compares the explicit TTL to the protocol TTL, if any. The effective TTL is the lesser of the two values. If the explicit TTL is 5 and the protocol TTL is 10, uses 5. Without a protocol TTL, equivalent to absolute.

value.summary: Use the configured TTL as the minimum possible TTL
value.name: minimum
value.description: Compares the explicit TTL to the protocol TTL, if any. The effective TTL is the greater of the two values. If the explicit TTL is 5 and the protocol TTL is 10, uses 10. Without a protocol TTL, the effective TTL is 86400.

schema.description: How to cache authentication results.

schema.name: AUCacheTTL
schema.summary: Enter the expiry for cached authentication decisions.
schema.description: The expiry for cached authentication decisions. Enter a value in the range 1 - 86400. The default value is 600.

schema.name: AULDAPReadTimeout
schema.summary: Enter the time to wait for a response from the LDAP server before the DataPower Gateway closes the connection.
schema.description: The time to wait for a response from the LDAP server before the DataPower Gateway closes the LDAP connection. Enter a value in the range 0 - 86400. The default value is 60. A value of 0 indicates that the connection never times out.

schema.name: MCMethod
schema.summary: Set the method to map authenticated user credentials to access profiles.

value.summary: Use the user group on the DataPower Gateway.
value.name: local

value.summary: Use an XML file on the DataPower Gateway.
value.name: xmlfile

value.summary: Use a custom stylesheet.
value.name: custom

schema.description: The method to map authenticated user credentials to access profiles.

schema.name: MCCustomURL
schema.summary: Enter the URL of custom stylesheet.
schema.description: The URL of custom stylesheet.

schema.name: MCLDAPSearchForGroup
schema.summary: Indicate whether to search LDAP to retrieve all user groups that match the query.
schema.description: <p>Whether to search LDAP to retrieve all user groups that match the query.</p><ul><li>When enabled, the authenticated DN of the user and the LDAP search parameters are used as part of the LDAP search to retrieve all user groups that match the query. When a user belongs to multiple groups, the resultant access policy for this user is additive not most restrictive.</li><li>When disabled, the authenticated identity of the user (DN or user group of local user) is used directly as the input credential.</li></ul>

schema.name: MCHost
schema.summary: Enter the host name or IP address of the server.
schema.description: The host name or IP address of the server.

schema.name: MCPort
schema.summary: Enter the listening port on the server.
schema.description: The listening port on the server.

schema.name: MCLDAPSSLProxyProfile
schema.summary: The TLS proxy profile is deprecated. Use a TLS client profile.
schema.description: The TLS proxy profile to secure the connection with the LDAP server.

schema.name: MCLDAPLoadBalanceGroup
schema.summary: Set the load balancer group of LDAP servers.
schema.description: The load balancer group of LDAP servers.

schema.name: MCLDAPBindDN
schema.summary: Enter the DN to bind to the LDAP server for the LDAP search.
schema.description: The DN to bind to the LDAP server for the LDAP search.

schema.name: MCLDAPBindPassword
schema.summary: Enter the password for the DN to bind to the LDAP server for the LDAP search.
schema.description: The password for the DN to bind to the LDAP server for the LDAP search.

schema.name: MCLDAPBindPasswordAlias
schema.summary: Enter the password alias for the password for the DN to bind to the LDAP server for the LDAP search.
schema.description: The password alias for the password for the DN to bind to the LDAP server for the LDAP search.

schema.name: MCLDAPSearchParameters
schema.summary: Set the LDAP search parameters for the LDAP search.
schema.description: The LDAP search parameters for the LDAP search.

schema.name: MCInfoURL
schema.summary: Enter the URL of the XML file to map credentials.
schema.description: The URL of the XML file to map credentials. The XML file can be on the DataPower Gateway or on a remote server. You can use the same XML file for authentication.

schema.name: MCLDAPReadTimeout
schema.summary: Enter the time to wait for a response from the LDAP server before the DataPower Gateway closes the connection.
schema.description: The time to wait for a response from the LDAP server before the DataPower Gateway closes the LDAP connection. Enter a value in the range 0 - 86400. The default value is 60. A value of 0 indicates that the connection never times out.

schema.name: LDAPVersion
schema.summary: Set the LDAP protocol version to use.

value.summary: LDAP v2
value.name: v2

value.summary: LDAP v3
value.name: v3

schema.description: The LDAP protocol version to use.

schema.name: FallbackLogin

value.summary: No local user accounts can log in.
value.name: disabled

value.summary: All local user accounts can log in.
value.name: local

value.summary: Only the defined subset of local user accounts can log in.
value.name: restricted

schema.summary: Indicate whether to use local user accounts as fallback users if remote authentication fails.
schema.description: <p>Whether to use local user accounts as fallback users if remote authentication fails. With fallback users, local user accounts can log on to the DataPower Gateway if authentication fails or during a network outage that affects primary authentication. The recommendation is to restrict fallback users to a subset of local user accounts.</p><p><b>Note: </b>When authentication uses a TLS certificate from a connection peer, you cannot enforce RBM on CLI sessions unless fallback users are supported.</p>

schema.name: FallbackUser
schema.summary: Set the list of local user accounts that are fallback users.
schema.description: The list of local user accounts that are fallback users.

schema.name: ApplyToCLI
schema.summary: Indicate whether to enforce the RBM policy on CLI sessions.
schema.description: Whether to enforce the RBM policy on CLI sessions. When authentication uses a TLS certificate from a connection peer, you cannot enforce RBM on CLI sessions unless fallback users are supported.

schema.name: RestrictAdminToSerialPort
schema.summary: Indicate whether to restrict admin user account to serial port.
schema.description: <p>Whether to restrict the <tt>admin</tt> user account to the serial port.</p>

schema.name: MinPasswordLength
schema.summary: Enter the minimum length of a valid password.
schema.description: The minimum length of a valid password. Enter a value in the range 1 - 128. The default value is 6.

schema.name: RequireMixedCase
schema.summary: Indicate whether passwords must contain both uppercase and lowercase characters.
schema.description: Whether passwords must contain both uppercase and lowercase characters.

schema.name: RequireDigit
schema.summary: Indicate whether passwords must contain at least one number.
schema.description: Whether passwords must contain at least one number.

schema.name: RequireNonAlphaNumeric
schema.summary: Indicate whether passwords must contain at least one special, non-alphanumeric character.
schema.description: Whether passwords must contain at least one special, non-alphanumeric character.

schema.name: DisallowUsernameSubstring
schema.summary: Indicate whether passwords can never contain the user name as a substring.
schema.description: Whether passwords can never contain the user name as a substring.

schema.name: DoPasswordAging
schema.summary: Indicates whether passwords expires.
schema.description: Whether passwords expires.

schema.name: MaxPasswordAge
schema.summary: Enter the expiry for passwords.
description: The expiry for passwords Enter a value in the range 1 - 65535. The default value is 30.
Enter the expiry for passwords Enter a value in the range 1 - 65535.

schema.name: DoPasswordHistory
schema.summary: Indicates whether to control the reuse of recent passwords.
schema.description: Whether to control the reuse of recent passwords.

schema.name: NumOldPasswords
schema.summary: Enter the number of recent passwords to track to prevent reuse.
schema.description: The number of recent passwords to track to prevent reuse. Enter a value in the range 1 - 65535. The default value is 5.

schema.name: CliTimeout
schema.summary: Enter the time after which to invalidate idle CLI sessions.
schema.description: The time after which to invalidate idle CLI sessions. When invalidated, requires reauthentication. Enter a value in the range 0 - 65535. The default value is 600. A value of 0 disables the timer.

schema.name: MaxFailedLogin
schema.summary: Enter the number of failed login attempts to allow before account lockout.
schema.description: The number of failed login attempts to allow before account lockout. Enter a value in the range of 0 - 64, where 0 disables account lockout. The default value is 0.

schema.name: LockoutPeriod
schema.summary: Enter the duration to lock out local user accounts after the maximum number of failed login attempts is exceeded.
schema.description: <p>The duration to lock out local user accounts after the maximum number of failed login attempts is exceeded. Instead of locking out accounts for a specific duration, the account can be locked out until re-enabled by a privileged user. Enter a value in the range 0 - 1000, where 0 locks out accounts until reset. The default value is 1.</p><p><b>Note:</b> The duration applies to all local accounts, including the <tt>admin</tt> user account. The only difference is that the <tt>admin</tt> user account cannot be locked out until reset. When the duration is 0, the <tt>admin</tt> user account is locked out for 120 minutes or until re-enabled by a privileged user.</p>

schema.name: MCForceDNLDAPOrder
schema.summary: Indicate whether to convert the extracted DN to LDAP format.
schema.description: <p>Whether to convert the extracted DN to LDAP format. This property is essential when the extracted DN from a TLS certificate is in X.500 format. This format arranges the RDNs of the DNs from left to right with forward slashes as separators; for example, <tt>C=US/O=My Organization/CN=Fred</tt> .</p><p>When you retrieve the group name with an LDAP search, the authenticated DN must be in LDAP format. This format arranges the RDNs of the DNs from right to left with commas as separators; for example, <tt>CN=Fred, O=My Organization, C=US</tt> .</p>

schema.name: PasswordHashAlgorithm

type.name: dmPasswordFileHashAlgorithm
type.description: The hash algorithm used for user account passwords.

schema.summary: Set the hash algorithm to apply to passwords.
schema.description: <p>The hash algorithm to apply to passwords before they are stored. The hash algorithm affects firmware downgrade and cryptographic modes in the following ways.</p><ul><li>For firmware downgrade, sha256crypt is not supported in releases earlier than 6.0.1.0.</li><li>For cryptographic modes, like FIPS 140-2 Level 1, md5crypt is not supported in FIPS mode.</li></ul>

schema.name: LDAPSSLClientConfigType
schema.summary: Set the TLS profile type to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets
schema.description: The TLS profile type to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets.

schema.name: LDAPSSLClientProfile
schema.summary: Set the TLS client profile to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets
schema.description: The TLS client profile to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets.

schema.name: MCLDAPSSLClientConfigType
schema.summary: Set the TLS profile type to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets
schema.description: The TLS profile type to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets.

schema.name: MCLDAPSSLClientProfile
schema.summary: Set the TLS client profile to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets
schema.description: The TLS client profile to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets.
